creditline: Gift of Martin Levy in honor of his father
description: firescreen with floral design; copper 'petals' project outward from domed brass center; brass stand
text: This simple, elegant screen served as a shield from fireplace heat. William Arthur Smith Benson favored minimalism in metalwork and used machine production to achieve it. Here, petal-like sheets of rolled copper, bent slightly to create an octagonal design, are attached to a brass pole. The shape suggests a ship’s propeller—further evidence of Benson’s keen interest in machines.
title: Fire screen
